poem:
**Promises and Paper**

In Downing Street, a promise cast  
like paper ships on uncertain seas.  
Words drift in parliamentary breeze,  
migration dreams, those sails and masts.  

Through the fog, statistics lie,  
truth a distant, whispered sigh.  
Hope unfixed, in headlines sown,  
as borders breathe on futures flown.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Keir Starmer promises net migration will fall ‘significantly’ by end of this parliament – UK politics live 9.53am BST Key points from Starmer's press conference on immigration Keir Starmer did not go into detail during his speech and Q&A in Downing Street this morning. The Home Office has not published the immigration white paper yet (although it has extensively trailed most or all of the key announcements), and this morning it felt as if Starmer’s". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
